channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Gate locked: main route for children cycling to Leckhampton High School now blocked, 11th September
item.description:
The route through Burrows Field and Lotts Meadow is used by a huge number of children from Naunton Park and Leckhampton cycling to HSL school. The gate into Lotts Meadow from Kidnappers Lane has now been padlocked shut (almost spitefully), meaning children cannot get their bikes through it. The circular pedestrian gate does not allow bikes through. As a consequence, children must take the much more dangerous and longer cycle route along Church Road on the carriageway with traffic, or detour to the Shurdington Road (which is currently more dangerous because of all the roadworks). If the gate cannot be unlocked, could the council look to install a pedestrian gate which allows bikes through, please? I presume the council's position is still to encourage children to cycle to school. I and a good number of HSL parents are concerned about the safety of our children cycling to school if this essential route is cut off to them. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic light when you’re facing the park campus has been clipped and is facing towards the other lane., 11th September
item.description:
One of the permanent traffic lights on Shurdington Road/Moorend Park Road might have been clipped by a lorry and is now facing towards the Norwood Pub direction and not towards the Leckhampton Surgery direction as it should be. I’m worried that this could confusion and an accident as it gives a green signal to the road that should be waiting on red.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: The road has sunk and is quite a bump to drive over. There are a couple more towards stoke orchard, 11th September
item.description:
Opposite the turn and on way to Stoke Orchard. Been present for a few weeks. There are two not quite as bad dips in the road further towards stoke Orchard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 11th September
item.description:
Customer is located within the area of the works, which will impact upon their business; they complain that they have received no notice/correspondence. Please can Highways confirm the extent of the (lane?) closure and what the access arrangements to their premises/the street will be?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 11th September
item.description:
Customer has called to ask for more information on what access is going to be like during works as the goods entrance accepts multiple HGVs a day, and is concerned that there will not be space with the excavations taking place opposite
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chamber lid still loose - not fixed, 11th September
item.description:
On September 10, 2025, your team of street works engineers visited this site to address the issue of the loose chamber lid, which was causing a banging noise whenever a vehicle passed over it. Please refer to the previous reports for more details. As of today, the issue remains unresolved. Your engineers returned to the site to restore the tarmac around the chamber; yesterday however, they did not rectify the actual problem of the loose chamber lid. only replaced the surrounding tarmac- This lid is positioned lower than the carriageway and is divided into two parts. While I do not believe this is a defect, as other drains also have two halves, the noise created when vehicles drive over this chamber results in a loud banging and thudding sound. Due to the local road closures, this road has become very busy, leading to constant noise throughout the day, evening, and early morning hours, which is driving us to distraction and disturbing our sleep. It is exhausting. Could your inspector revisit the site to assess the situation and place a large cone on top of it, along with road signs or any other measures necessary to prevent vehicles from driving over this chamber until the issue is resolved? I am uncertain if a new drain cover is required to ensure it is level with the carriageway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Green, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 11th September
item.description:
Customer reports that the gulley(s) at the location are blocked. In the event of rain, the cellars of the location and surrounding properties are becoming flooded.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned caravan, 11th September
item.description:
Noticed during w/c 8/9/25, a caravan has been left in the layby on the A4019 between Uckington village and M5 J10. Concern re. potential antisocial behaviour/arson.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
